content:
that you are seriously injured in an accident and the doctors dis-
cover that youare made from wires, transistors, and so on. Would this
convince you that you had never really thought or felt anything? If your
answer to this question is different from your answer to the previous
question, explain why.
11.   Searle predicts that, “As computers and robots become more common, . . .
people will take computers for what they are, namely useful machines.”
Do you agree? Why or why not?
